title: Ukrainian children go to school in subway stations as Russian forces bomb Kharkiv
description: Schools in Kharkiv are holding classes in underground subway stations as Russian forces bomb the city almost every day. The kids seem to be doing alright, but teachers tell NBC News’ Richard Engel that they’re worried about the effects of war.

title: Thousands of women march in Latin America for abortion rights
description: The streets of cities across Latin America were bathed in green Thursday as tens of thousands of women marched to commemorate International Safe Abortion Day.

title: More migrants are victims of rape, sexual violence at Mexico border
description: There's an increase in rapes and sexual violence against migrants in the border cities of Reynosa and Matamoros, both major transit routes for immigrants.

title: Dozens killed in blasts targeting gatherings in Pakistan to celebrate the Prophet Muhammad's birthday
description: Dozens of people have been killed in separate blasts in Pakistan at religious gatherings held to celebrate the Prophet Muhammad's birthday.

title: The world's oldest shoes? Sandals found in bat cave are thousands of years old, study finds
description: Sandals buried in a bat cave in southern Spain may be the oldest footwear ever discovered in Europe, scientists said.

title: Family pays tribute to girl, 15, stabbed to death on her way to school in south London
description: A 17-year-old male has been charged with murder of Elianne Andam, 15, who was stabbed to death on her way to school in south London.

title: ‘Deliberate’ felling of a famous tree at Hadrian’s Wall sparks outcry; 16-year-old boy arrested
description: A 16-year-old boy was arrested Thursday in northern England in connection with what authorities described as the “deliberate” felling of a famous tree that had stood for nearly 200 years next to the Roman landmark Hadrian’s Wall.

title: Swedish leader summons army as gang violence rocks the nation
description: Sweden’s prime minister summoned the head of the armed forces and the police commissioner in a bid to stem gang violence, he said on Thursday, following a wave of violence that has taken at least 11 lives in September alone.

title: Explosion at rally celebrating prophet's birthday kills dozens in Pakistan
description: A powerful bomb exploded near a mosque at a rally celebrating the birthday of Islam’s Prophet Muhammad in southwestern Pakistan on Friday, killing at least 52 people and injuring nearly 70 others, police and a government official said.

title: President Putin meets with a former top Wagner commander and tasks him with overseeing volunteer fighting units in Ukraine
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with a former top Wagner commander, Andrei Troshev, and tasked him with overseeing volunteer fighting units in Ukraine, the Kremlin said Friday.

title: Putin tasks top Wagner commander with overseeing volunteer fighters in Ukraine
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with former Wagner commander Andrei Troshev,and tasked him with overseeing volunteer fighting units in Ukraine, the Kremlin said Friday.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh to dissolve after years-long war with Azerbaijan ends
description: After years of conflict, the war between Nagorno-Karabakh and Azerbaijan has finally ended. The contested region now falls under Azerbaijani control as tens of thousands of ethnic Armenians flee their homeland. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports.
